tuv.seg: Public order offences and powers of arrest
Cionta in aghaidh oird phoiblí agus cumhachtaí gabhála
The Gardaí have the powers to arrest without warrant people guilty of the following offences under the Criminal Justice (Public Order) Act, 1994:
Tá sé de chumhacht ag comhaltaí den Gharda Síochána daoine a ghabháil gan barántas má tá siad ciontach as na coireanna seo a leanas faoin Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Ord Poiblí) 1994:
• Being intoxicated in a public place (Section 4)
• Bheith ar meisce in áit phoiblí (Alt 4)
• Committing threatening or abusive behaviour in a public place (Section 6)
• Iompraíocht bhagrach, mhaslach nó tharcaisneach a bheith ar siúl acu in áit phoiblí (Alt 6)
• Distributing or displaying threatening, obscene or insulting material in a public place (Section 7)
• Ábhar bagrach graosta nó tharcaisneach a scaipeadh nó a thaispeáint in áit phoiblí (Alt 7)
• Failing to comply with the direction of a Garda (Section 8)
• Mainneachtain ordú ó chomhalta den Gharda Síochána a chomhlíonadh (Alt 8)
• Entering a building, etc, with intent to commit an offence (Section 11)
• Dul isteach i bhfoirgneamh etc., le hintinn cion a dhéanamh (Alt 11)
• Trespassing on a dwelling, etc. (Section 13)
• Foghail a dhéanamh ar áitreabh, is araile (Alt 13)
• Committing acts of violent disorder (Section 15)
• Bearta mírialtachta foréigní a dhéanamh (Alt 15)
• Committing affray (Section 16)
• Bearta gráscair a dhéanamh (Alt 16)
• Blackmailing and demanding money with menaces (Section 17)
• Dúmhál agus airgead a éileamh go bagrach (Alt 17)
• Committing an assault with intent to cause bodily harm or to commit an indictable offence (Section 18)
• Ionsaí a dhéanamh a bhfuil sé d'aidhm aige dochar corpartha a dhéanamh nó cion indíotáilte a dhéanamh(Alt 18)
• Assaulting or obstructing a peace officer (Section 19)
• Ionsaí nó toirmeasc a dhéanamh ar oifigeach síochána (Alt 19)
As can be seen from the above, the Gardaí are given a power of arrest without warrant for almost all of the offences contained in this Act
Is léir ón liosta thuas go bhfuil sé de chumhacht ag comhaltaí den Garda Síochána daoine a ghabháil gan barántas de bharr formhór na gcoireanna a luaitear san Acht seo
For the offence of riot, violent disorder or affray, the bystander test is applied
Cuirtear slat tomhais an fhéachadóra i bhfeidhm i gcás círéibe, mírialtachta foréigní nó gráscair
This means that if a bystander was present at the scene of the event or offence while it is being committed, they would fear for their own safety or the safety of someone else
Ciallaíonn sé seo nach gá go mbeifeá i láthair ag teagmhas nó cion nuair atá sé á dhéanamh ach dá mbeifeá i láthair go mbeadh faitíos ort go mbeifeá féin nó duine eile i mbaol
In the Act a number of offences are included which only become offences if they are committed in a public place
Tá roinnt cionta san Acht nach cionta iad mura ndéantar iad in áit phoiblí
For example, offences under Sections 4 to 9 of the Act are limited to a public place
Baineann na coireanna ó Alt 4 go hAlt 9 le háiteanna poiblí amháin
The definition of a public place is contained in Section 3 of the Act and includes almost all places
Thugtar sainmhíniú ar áit phoiblí in Alt 3 agus baineann sé le beagnach gach áit
It is one of the widest definitions of a public place in the criminal justice system
Tá sé ar cheann de na sainmhínithe i leithne ar áit phoiblí sa chóras ceartais choiriúil go léir

Is féidir leat níos mó a léamh faoi Chionta in aghaidh oird phoiblí ach cliceáil anseo
Public order offences and the Adult Cautioning Scheme
Cionta in aghaidh oird phoiblí agus an Scéim um Rabhadh Aosach
Under the Adult Cautioning Scheme (introduced in February 2006), a number of public order offences are included in the list of offences which may be dealt with by way of caution under the Scheme
Tugadh isteach an Scéim um Rabhadh Aosach i mí Feabhra 2006 agus cuireadh roinnt cionta in aghaidh oird phoiblí leis an liosta cionta ar féidir déileáil leo trí rabhadh a thabhairt faoin Scéim
If you are cautioned under this Scheme it means you are not brought into the court system
Má thugtar rabhadh duit faoin Scéim ní thugtar os comhair cúirte thú
The public order offences which can be dealt with by way of caution are:
Is iad seo a leanas na cionta in aghaidh oird phoiblí ar féidir déileáil leo trí rabhadh a thabhairt:
• Being intoxicated in a public place (Section 4)
• A bheith ar meisce in áit phoiblí (Alt 4)
• Committing disorderly conduct in a public place (Section 5)
• Iompar mí-ordúil a bheith ar siúl in áit phoiblí (Alt 5)
• Threatening, abusive or insulting behaviour in a public place (Section 6)
• Iompraíocht bhagrach, mhaslach nó tharcaisneach in áit phoiblí (Alt 6)
• Failing to comply with a direction of a Garda (Section 8)
• Mainneachtain ordú ó chomhalta den Gharda Síochána a chomhlíonadh (Alt 8)
• Committing wilful obstruction (Section 9)
• Bac toiliúil (bac d'aon ghnó) a dhéanamh (Alt 9)
• Entering a building, etc., with intent to commit an offence (Section 11)
• Dul isteach i bhfoirgneamh, is araile, le hintinn cion a dhéanamh (Alt 11)
• Surrendering and having seized intoxicating liquor, etc., (Section 22)
• Deoch mheisciúil is araile a thabhairt suas agus í a bheith gafa (Alt 22)
There is more information on the Adult Cautioning Scheme here
Tá tuilleadh eolais faoin Scéim um Rabhadh Aosach anseo
